Text:
Urg! once again another THETA release another virus/trojan warning. Not sure if I will fully trust their releases.

Trojan.W32.Chifrax.a Well thats what KIS2012 reported.

@XtraZoom
Its a false positive, Kaspersky (along with a few others) are incredibly overprotective agianst the slightest of threats. Anywho you can try googling it?
Why a .rar? That is absolutely stupid. If it weren't for that terrible archive format weren't used, I could actually update in like 2 minutes rather than having to re-download everything

@really_common_sense
Its a scene release.... I prefer to keep it in its original state.

download finished at 12:59:04 (Portugal Time)

Thank you for great release/upload, and thank you for seeding at such an high speed
